001package imagingbook.pub.dft;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004
005import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
006
007/**
008 * Two-dimensional DFT implementation.
009 * @author WB
010 *
011 */
012public abstract class Dft2d {
013        
014        final ScalingMode sm;
015        boolean useFastMode = true;
016        
017        public void useFastMode(boolean yesOrNo) {
018                this.useFastMode = yesOrNo;
019        }
020        
021        private Dft2d() {
022                this(ScalingMode.DEFAULT);
023        }
024        
025        private Dft2d(ScalingMode sm) {
026                this.sm = sm;
027        }
028        
029        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
030        
031        public static class Float extends Dft2d {
032                
033                /**
034                 * Performs an "in-place" 2D DFT forward transformation on the supplied data.
035                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DFT spectrum.
036                 * @param gRe real part of the signal (modified)
037                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the signal (modified)
038                 */
039                public void forward(float[][] gRe, float[][] gIm) {
040                        checkSize(gRe, gIm);
041                        transform(gRe, gIm, true);
042                }
043                
044                /**
045                 * Performs an "in-place" 2D DFT inverse transformation on the supplied spectrum.
046                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
047                 * @param GRe real part of the spectrum (modified)
048                 * @param GIm imaginary part of the spectrum (modified)
049                 */
050                public void inverse(float[][] GRe, float[][] GIm) {
051                        checkSize(GRe, GIm);
052                        transform(GRe, GIm, false);
053                }
054                
055                /**
056                 * Transforms the given 2D arrays 'in-place'. Separate arrays of identical size
057                 * must be supplied for the real and imaginary parts of the signal (forward) 
058                 * or spectrum (inverse), neither of which may be null.
059                 * 
060                 * @param inRe real part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
061                 * @param inIm imaginary part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
062                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
063                 */
064                void transform(float[][] inRe, float[][] inIm, boolean forward) {
065                        final int width = inRe.length;
066                        final int height = inRe[0].length;
067
068                        // transform each row (in place):
069                        final float[] rowRe = new float[width];
070                        final float[] rowIm = new float[width];
071                        Dft1d.Float dftRow = 
072                                        useFastMode ? new Dft1dFast.Float(width, sm) : new Dft1dDirect.Float(width, sm);
073                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
074                                extractRow(inRe, v, rowRe);
075                                extractRow(inIm, v, rowIm);
076                                dftRow.transform(rowRe, rowIm, forward);
077                                insertRow(inRe, v, rowRe);
078                                insertRow(inIm, v, rowIm);
079                        }
080
081                        // transform each column (in place):
082                        final float[] colRe = new float[height];
083                        final float[] colIm = new float[height];
084                        Dft1d.Float dftCol = 
085                                        useFastMode ? new Dft1dFast.Float(height, sm) : new Dft1dDirect.Float(height, sm);
086                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
087                                extractCol(inRe, u, colRe);
088                                extractCol(inIm, u, colIm);
089                                dftCol.transform(colRe, colIm, forward);
090                                insertCol(inRe, u, colRe);
091                                insertCol(inIm, u, colIm);
092                        }
093                }
094                
095                // extract the values of row 'v' of 'g' into 'row'
096                private void extractRow(float[][] g, int v, float[] row) {
097                        if (g == null) {                        // TODO: check if needed
098                                Arrays.fill(row, 0);
099                        }
100                        else {
101                                for (int u = 0; u < row.length; u++) {
102                                        row[u] = g[u][v];
103                                }
104                        }
105                }
106
107                // insert 'row' into row 'v' of 'g'
108                private void insertRow(float[][] g, int v, float[] row) {
109                        for (int u = 0; u < row.length; u++) {
110                                g[u][v] = row[u];
111                        }
112                }
113
114                // extract the values of column 'u' of 'g' into 'cols'
115                private void extractCol(float[][] g, int u, float[] col) {
116                        if (g == null) {                        // TODO: check if needed
117                                Arrays.fill(col, 0);
118                        }
119                        else {
120                                for (int v = 0; v < col.length; v++) {
121                                        col[v] = g[u][v];
122                                }
123                        }
124                }
125
126                // insert 'col' into column 'u' of 'g'
127                private void insertCol(float[][] g, final int u, float[] col) {
128                        for (int v = 0; v < col.length; v++) {
129                                g[u][v] = col[v];
130                        }
131                }
132                
133                /**
134                 * Calculates and returns the magnitude of the supplied complex-valued 2D data.
135                 * @param re the real part of the data
136                 * @param im the imaginary part of the data
137                 * @return a 2D array of magnitude values
138                 */
139                public float[][] getMagnitude(float[][] re, float[][] im) {
140                        checkSize(re, im);
141                        final int width = re.length;
142                        final int height = re[0].length;
143                        float[][] mag = new float[width][height];
144                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
145                                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
146                                        float a = re[u][v];
147                                        float b = im[u][v];
148                                        mag[u][v] = (float) Math.sqrt(a*a + b*b);
149                                }
150                        }
151                        return mag;
152                }
153                
154                private void checkSize(float[][] re, float[][] im) {
155                        if (!Matrix.sameSize(re, im))
156                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("arrays for real/imagingary parts must be of same size");
157                }
158                
159        }
160        
161        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
162        
163        public static class Double extends Dft2d {
164                
165
166                public void forward(double[][] gRe, double[][] gIm) {
167                        checkSize(gRe, gIm);
168                        transform(gRe, gIm, true);
169                }
170                
171                public void inverse(double[][] GRe, double[][] GIm) {
172                        checkSize(GRe, GIm);
173                        transform(GRe, GIm, false);
174                }
175                
176                /**
177                 * Transforms the given 2D arrays 'in-place', i.e., real and imaginary
178                 * arrays of identical size must be supplied, neither may be null.
179                 * 
180                 * @param gRe
181                 * @param gIm
182                 * @param forward
183                 */
184                void transform(double[][] gRe, double[][] gIm, boolean forward) {
185                        final int width = gRe.length;
186                        final int height = gRe[0].length;
187
188                        // transform each row (in place):
189                        final double[] rowRe = new double[width];
190                        final double[] rowIm = new double[width];
191                        Dft1d.Double dftRow = 
192                                        useFastMode ? new Dft1dFast.Double(width, sm) : new Dft1dDirect.Double(width, sm);
193                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
194                                extractRow(gRe, v, rowRe);
195                                extractRow(gIm, v, rowIm);
196                                dftRow.transform(rowRe, rowIm, forward);
197                                insertRow(gRe, v, rowRe);
198                                insertRow(gIm, v, rowIm);
199                        }
200
201                        // transform each column (in place):
202                        final double[] colRe = new double[height];
203                        final double[] colIm = new double[height];
204                        Dft1d.Double dftCol = 
205                                        useFastMode ? new Dft1dFast.Double(height, sm) : new Dft1dDirect.Double(height, sm);
206                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
207                                extractCol(gRe, u, colRe);
208                                extractCol(gIm, u, colIm);
209                                dftCol.transform(colRe, colIm, forward);
210                                insertCol(gRe, u, colRe);
211                                insertCol(gIm, u, colIm);
212                        }
213                }
214                
215                // extract the values of row 'v' of 'g' into 'row'
216                private void extractRow(double[][] g, int v, double[] row) {
217                        if (g == null) {                        // TODO: check if needed
218                                Arrays.fill(row, 0);
219                        }
220                        else {
221                                for (int u = 0; u < row.length; u++) {
222                                        row[u] = g[u][v];
223                                }
224                        }
225                }
226
227                // insert 'row' into row 'v' of 'g'
228                private void insertRow(double[][] g, int v, double[] row) {
229                        for (int u = 0; u < row.length; u++) {
230                                g[u][v] = row[u];
231                        }
232                }
233
234                // extract the values of column 'u' of 'g' into 'cols'
235                private void extractCol(double[][] g, int u, double[] col) {
236                        if (g == null) {                        // TODO: check if needed
237                                Arrays.fill(col, 0);
238                        }
239                        else {
240                                for (int v = 0; v < col.length; v++) {
241                                        col[v] = g[u][v];
242                                }
243                        }
244                }
245
246                // insert 'col' into column 'u' of 'g'
247                private void insertCol(double[][] g, final int u, double[] col) {
248                        for (int v = 0; v < col.length; v++) {
249                                g[u][v] = col[v];
250                        }
251                }
252                
253                /**
254                 * Calculates and returns the magnitude of the supplied complex-valued 2D data.
255                 * @param re the real part of the data
256                 * @param im the imaginary part of the data
257                 * @return a 2D array of magnitude values
258                 */
259                public double[][] getMagnitude(double[][] re, double[][] im) {
260                        checkSize(re, im);
261                        final int width = re.length;
262                        final int height = re[0].length;
263                        double[][] mag = new double[width][height];
264                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
265                                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
266                                        double a = re[u][v];
267                                        double b = im[u][v];
268                                        mag[u][v] = Math.sqrt(a*a + b*b);
269                                }
270                        }
271                        return mag;
272                }
273                
274                private void checkSize(double[][] re, double[][] im) {
275                        if (!Matrix.sameSize(re, im))
276                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("arrays for real/imagingary parts must be of same size");
277                }
278                
279        }
280
281}
